articles.title: WHO switches to Greek alphabet for virus variant names to avoid stigma - South China Morning Post
articles.description: Under the new system, the so-called British variant B.1.1.7 becomes Alpha; B.1.351 first discovered in South Africa is Beta, while the Brazilian P.1 is Gamma.

articles.title: Indian Vaccine Export Ban Makes 91 Nations Vulnerable To New Strains: WHO - NDTV
articles.description: India's ban of Covid vaccine exports has dried up the supplies of many nations, especially those in Africa, who were dependent on them. Now they are vulnerable to many strains of the disease, WHO Chief Scientist Dr Soumya Swaminathan has said.
articles.content:
Most African nations have vaccinated less than 0.5% of their populations, said Dr Soumya Swaminathan.
